text: How might we make it faster and easier for new Catalyst members to take on suitable roles and responsibilities in 2022?

tabs.title: Description
tabs.content: The growth of Project Catalyst depends on meaningful participation from proposers, advisors, mentors and voters who are both eager and capable to fulfill their roles and understand their responsibilities.

tabs.title: Guiding questions
tabs.content:
How might we convert passive ADA holders into active Catalyst members?
	How might we increase awareness of Project Catalyst as the most active open innovation platform?
	How might we increase more meaningful participation from challenge teams, proposers, advisors, mentors and voters? What kind of additional roles are needed?
	How might we encourange new members to utillize the tools and services availalbe for onboarding?
	How might we improve the use of existing text, video and audio materials?

tabs.title: Why is it important?
tabs.content: The success of Catalyst depends on the availability of quality challenge teams, proposers, advisors, mentors and voters.

tabs.title: What does success look like?
tabs.content: A well-oiled open innovation platform where people fulfill roles that are meaningful for them and that contribute to shared success.

tabs.title: Key Metrics to measure
tabs.content: The metrics can be divided to two sections. General onboarding refers to bringing people in and converting them from mere lurkers to voters and potential proposers. Innovation process metrics refer to the quantity and quality of proposals and activity around them.

tabs.title: General onboarding:
tabs.content:
Weekly sign ups to Cardano Ideascale
	Townhall attendance
	Catalyst School session attendance
	Swarm session attendance
	Applications to leadership positions (e.g. Circle)

tabs.title: Innovation process:
tabs.content:
Number of referrers
	Reduction in the number of unready proposals
	Growtn in the number of 4-5 star proposals
	Growth in the number of Community Advisors and Veteran Community Advisors
	Percentage of proposals with Excellent assessments
	Growth in the number of voters
	Growth in total number of votes given
